text: The Lahore Qalandars cricket team is one of six teams that competed in the 2019 Pakistan Super League, representing Lahore. Originally the Qalandars were to be captained by Mohammad Hafeez, but due to an injury, he was unable to participate. AB De Villiers captained two matches while Fakhar Zaman led the side in six matches. They finished sixth in the season after winning three of their ten matches, and as a result, were eliminated in the group stage for the fourth consecutive year. Lahore Qalandars Brand Ambassador Shaheen Shah Afridi is a renowned bowler. ==Squad== ==Season standings== ===Points table=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center" ! style="width:170px"|Team ! style="width:35px"| ! style="width:35px"| ! style="width:35px"| ! style="width:35px"| ! style="width:35px"| ! style="width:35px"| ! style="width:50px"| |-style="background:#bfc" | style="text-align:left" |Peshawar Zalmi |10 |7 |3 |0 |0 ! 14 | +0.828 |-style="background:#bfc" | style="text-align:left"|Quetta Gladiators |10 |7 |3 |0 |0 ! 14 | +0.376 |-style="background:#efc" | style="text- align:left"|Islamabad United |10 |5 |5 |0 |0 ! 10 | +0.127 |-style="background:#efc" | style="text-align:left"|Karachi Kings |10 |5 |5 |0 |0 ! 10 | –0.673 |- | colspan="12" style="background:#013;"| |- | style="text- align:left"|Multan Sultans |10 |3 |7 |0 |0 ! 6 | +0.173 |- | style="text- align:left"|Lahore Qalandars |10 |3 |7 |0 |0 ! 6 | –0.837 |} *The top 4 teams that qualified for the playoffs * Teams that advanced to Qualifier * Teams that advanced to Eliminator 1 ==Season summary== ==See also== * Islamabad United in 2019 * Karachi Kings in 2019 * Multan Sultans in 2019 * Peshawar Zalmi in 2019 * Quetta Gladiators in 2019 ==References== ==External links== Category:2019 in Punjab, Pakistan Category:2019 Pakistan Super League Qalandars in 2019 2019
